programme.title: Weird Science
programme.sub-title: Comedy, Romance, Sci Fi, Fantasy, Drama ║ 1985 ║ 12
programme.desc: Comedy fantasy starring Anthony Michael Hall, Ilan Mitchell-Smith and Kelly LeBrock. One stormy night, high-school computer nerds Gary and Wyatt feed all the components of their perfect woman into their PC and are stunned at the result. The room explodes and out of the smoke appears the beautiful Lisa, the answer to every young man's dream John Hughes - Director Anthony Michael Hall - Gary Ilan Mitchell-Smith - Wyatt Kelly LeBrock - Lisa Bill Paxton - Chet Suzanne Snyder - Deb Judie Aronson - Hilly Robert Downey Jr - Ian Robert Rusler - Max Vernon Wells - Lord General Britt Leach - Al Barbara Lang - Lucy Ivor Barry - Henry Anne Bernadette Coyle - Carmen Michael Berryman - Mutant biker Anthony Michael Hall - Gary Ilan Mitchell-Smith - Wyatt Kelly LeBrock - Lisa Bill Paxton - Chet Suzanne Snyder - Deb Judie Aronson - Hilly Robert Downey Jr - Ian Robert Rusler - Max Vernon Wells - Lord General Britt Leach - Al Barbara Lang - Lucy Ivor Barry - Henry Anne Bernadette Coyle - Carmen Michael Berryman - Mutant biker.

programme.title: Gorillas in the Mist
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Sigourney Weaver. Dian Fossey arrives in central Africa full of high ideals and a passion for nature, determined to research rare mountain gorillas faced with extinction. programme.title: Batteries Not Included
programme.sub-title: Comedy, Fantasy, Sci Fi, Family, Drama ║ 1987 ║ PG
programme.desc: Science-fiction fantasy starring Hume Cronyn and Jessica Tandy. programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring William Shatner and DeForest Kelley. Barely surviving the wrath of Khan, the battle-scarred starship Enterprise limps back to Earth, saved only by the sacrifice of the late Captain Spock. However, the Vulcan's spirit is still with the crew, and back on the artificial Eden of the new Genesis planet his corpse is missing. Against orders, Admiral Kirk decides to lead the search for Spock and bring him home Leonard Nimoy - Director William Shatner - Admiral James T Kirk DeForest Kelley - Dr Leonard \Bones\ McCoy James Doohan - Scotty George Takei - Sulu Walter Koenig - Chekov Nichelle Nichols - Uhura Christopher Lloyd - Kruge Robin Curtis - Lieutenant Saavik Merritt Butrick - David Marcus James B Sikking - Captain Styles Mark Lenard - Ambassador Sarek Leonard Nimoy - Spock William Shatner - Admiral James T Kirk DeForest Kelley - Dr Leonard \Bones\ McCoy James Doohan - Scotty George Takei - Sulu Walter Koenig - Chekov Nichelle Nichols - Uhura Christopher Lloyd - Kruge Robin Curtis - Lieutenant Saavik Merritt Butrick - David Marcus James B Sikking - Captain Styles Mark Lenard - Ambassador Sarek Leonard Nimoy - Spock.

programme.title: Shirley Valentine
programme.desc: Comedy written by Willy Russell from his own play, starring Pauline Collins and Tom Conti. Liverpool housewife Shirley leads a domestic existence of routine dullness. Her monosyllabic husband's only concern is to find his supper on the table on time - things are so bad, she confides in the kitchen wall. What she needs is a holiday; a place with sun, sand and sea, a place where she can fall in love with life Lewis Gilbert - Director Pauline Collins - Shirley Valentine Tom Conti - Costas Caldes Julia McKenzie - Gillian Alison Steadman - Jane Joanna Lumley - Marjorie Sylvia Syms - Headmistress Bernard Hill - Joe Bradshaw George Costigan - Dougie Anna Keaveney - Jeanette Tracie Bennett - Milandra Ken Sharrock - Sydney Karen Craig - Thelma Gareth Jefferson - Brian Pauline Collins - Shirley Valentine Tom Conti - Costas Caldes Julia McKenzie - Gillian Alison Steadman - Jane Joanna Lumley - Marjorie Sylvia Syms - Headmistress Bernard Hill - Joe Bradshaw George Costigan - Dougie Anna Keaveney - Jeanette Tracie Bennett - Milandra Ken Sharrock - Sydney Karen Craig - Thelma Gareth Jefferson - Brian.

programme.title: Jackie Chan's Armour of God
programme.desc: A fortune hunter and his sidekick tangle with a sinister cult-turned-criminal empire after unearthing some pieces of medieval armour. programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure sequel starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and Ricardo Montalban. In the 23rd century, Admiral James T Kirk is a guest aboard the Enterprise, which is taking part in a training exercise. programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.sub-title: Drama, Romance, Documentary And Factual ║ 1985 ║ PG
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biographical drama starring Meryl Streep and Robert Redford. Karen Blixen leaves her native Denmark in 1913 to marry a Swedish baron and run a coffee farm in Kenya. programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Geena Davis, Lori Petty and Madonna. programme.sub-title: Comedy, Action, Fantasy, Mystery, Drama ║ 2023 ║ PG
programme.desc: Paul Carpenter and Sophie Pettingel are lowly interns who begin working at the mysterious London firm JW Wells & Co. Charismatic villains Humphrey Wells, the CEO of the company, and middle manager Dennis Tanner are disrupting the world of magic by bringing modern corporate strategy to ancient magical practices. Paul and Sophie eventually discover the true agenda of the vast corporation where they work. programme.title: The Smurfs 2
programme.sub-title: Action, Animation, Comedy, Fantasy, Children's, Family, Drama ║ 2013 ║ U
programme.desc: Part-animated comedy starring Neil Patrick Harris. programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dachau Ellen Kuras - Director.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. programme.desc: United Archives 4/3/95. An amazing goal-fest at the Theatre of Dreams in March 95 as Andy Cole scored five times in an historic 9-0 victory over Ipswich Town.

programme.title: PL: Nottm Forest v United 98/99
programme.desc: United Archives 6/2/99. Former United boss Ron Atkinson was hoping to get one over his old club when they visited the City Ground with Forest deep in relegation trouble.

programme.title: PL: United v Everton 99/00
programme.desc: United Archives 4/12/99. The Intercontinental Cup champions return from Japan to put five goals past Everton, with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer grabbing four of them.

programme.title: PL: United v Southampton 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 28/10/00. United welcomed struggling Southampton looking to keep up their scintillating home form, having scored 22 goals in their opening six league contests at the Theatre of Dreams.

programme.title: PL: United v Arsenal 00/01
programme.desc: United Archives 25/2/01. United welcomed Arsenal knowing that victory would move them closer to securing a third consecutive Premiership crown.

programme.title: PL United v Southampton 01/02
programme.desc: United Archives 22/12/01. Sir Alex's side took on Southampton with the visitors looking for their first win at Old Trafford since January 1988.

programme.title: PL: United v Newcastle 02/03
programme.desc: United Archives 23/11/02. Ruud Van Nistelrooy makes the headlines in this game full of goals.
